title: Chinese Consulate in Medan donates aid to Medan Indonesian Ulema Council in March 2021
description: On March 20, 2021, the Chinese Consulate in Medan donated food aid to the Indonesian Ulema Council in Medan to help in the fight against Covid-19.  The contents and value of the donation are unknown.

title: Chinese Consulate in Surabaya donates Ramadan care packages to Muslims in Indonesia in May 2021
description: On May 6, 2021, the Chinese Consulate in Surabaya donated a batch of supplies to four local religious institutions: Zhenghe Mosque in Surabaya, Islamic Cleric Foundation, Muhammadiyah, and Council of Islamic Scholars. The donation included rice, sugar, instant noodles, and masks. The value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title

# Description
On May 6, 2021, the Chinese Consulate in Surabaya donated a batch of supplies to four local religious institutions: Zhenghe Mosque in Surabaya, Islamic Cleric Foundation, Muhammadiyah, and Council of Islamic Scholars. The donation included rice, sugar, instant noodles, and masks. The value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project involves humanitarian aid with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Ramadan care packages containing food items and masks, donated to religious institutions

title: Chinese government donates 10 liquid oxygen tanks to Indonesia for Covid relief in November 2021
description: On November 13, 2021, the Chinese government donated ten liquid oxygen tanks. It arrived in Jakarta, Indonesia. The donation will help Indonesia in its fight against Covid-19.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

On November 13, 2021, the Chinese government donated ten liquid oxygen tanks. It arrived in Jakarta, Indonesia. The donation will help Indonesia in its fight against Covid-19.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of liquid oxygen tanks for Covid-19 relief, healthcare sector

title: Chinese Government donates 250,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $4.5 million in February 2021
description: The Chinese Government delivered 250,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Iran on February 28, 2021. Then, on April 15, 2021, the Chinese Red Cross Society delivered 400,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Iran’s Ministry of Health (see project ID#95728). The Chinese Government delivered two additional batches of donated Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine doses to the Government of Iran in August 2021. The first batch consisted of 700,000 doses (see project ID#95729) and the second batch consisted of 1,550,000 doses (see project ID#95730).
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the February 2021 donation as $4.5 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

title: Chinese ambassador to Iran donates books to Secretary-General of the Expediency Discernment Council
description: On December 27, 2021, the Chinese ambassador to Iran met with newly-appointed secretary of Iran's Expediency Discernment Council Mohammad Bagher Zolghadr (Persian: محمدباقر ذوالقدر). Ambassador Chang Hua gave Zolghadr books, including "Xi Jinping: Governance of China" and "A Brief History of the Communist Party of China".
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese ambassador to Iran donates books to Secretary-General of the Expediency Discernment Council

# Description
On December 27, 2021, the Chinese ambassador to Iran met with newly-appointed secretary of Iran's Expediency Discernment Council Mohammad Bagher Zolghadr (Persian: محمدباقر ذوالقدر). Ambassador Chang Hua gave Zolghadr books, including "Xi Jinping: Governance of China" and "A Brief History of the Communist Party of China".
justification: Project involves cultural exchange and knowledge sharing without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Book donation, cultural exchange activity, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese ambassador to Iran donates Chinese stamps to Iran Post and Communications Museum
description: On December 11, 2021 the Chinese ambassador to Iran attended a ceremony for the issuance of a commemorative stamp celebrating the 50th anniversary of China-Iran relations. During this ceremony, Ambassador Chang Hua donated an album of Chinese stamps to the museum. On the same day, a celebration for the stamps was held in Chaozhou City, Guangdong Province.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese ambassador to Iran donates Chinese stamps to Iran Post and Communications Museum

# Description
On December 11, 2021 the Chinese ambassador to Iran attended a ceremony for the issuance of a commemorative stamp celebrating the 50th anniversary of China-Iran relations. During this ceremony, Ambassador Chang Hua donated an album of Chinese stamps to the museum. On the same day, a celebration for the stamps was held in Chaozhou City, Guangdong Province.
justification: Cultural exchange project with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of stamp collection, cultural diplomacy activity

title: Chinese Government provides USD 800,000 via Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations to Iran and Pakistan in June 2021
description: In June 2021, Chinese government provides USD 800,000 to Pakistan and Iran as a part of FAO-China SSC Programme supporting FAO's global action on the control of the Desert Locust.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides USD 800,000 via Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations to Iran and Pakistan in June 2021

# Description
In June 2021, Chinese government provides USD 800,000 to Pakistan and Iran as a part of FAO-China SSC Programme supporting FAO's global action on the control of the Desert Locust.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural support and pest control without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Funding through FAO for Desert Locust control, agricultural sector focus
